sen.j: 倭迹迹日百襲媛命（やまとととひももそひめのみこと、生没年不詳）は、孝霊天皇の皇女。
sen.e: Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto (date of birth and death unknown) was the Imperial princess of Emperor Korei.
Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto (date of birth and death unknown) was the Imperial princess of Emperor Korei.
Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto (date of birth and death unknown) was the Imperial princess of Emperor Korei.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』では、母は、倭国香媛（やまとのくにかひめ）。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), her mother was Yamato no kuni kahime.
According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), her mother was Yamato no kuni kahime.
According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), her mother was Yamato no kuni kahime.

sen.j: 同母兄弟に、倭迹迹稚屋姫命、彦五十狭芹彦命らが、異母兄弟に孝元天皇がいる。
sen.e: Her maternal half-brothers include Yamatototowakayahime no mikoto and Hikoisaseribiko no Mikoto, and her paternal half-brother was Emperor Kogen.
Her maternal half-brothers include Yamatototowakayahime no mikoto and Hikoisaseribiko no Mikoto, and her paternal half-brother was Emperor Kogen.
Her maternal half-brothers include Yamatototowakayahime no mikoto and Hikoisaseribiko no Mikoto, and her paternal half-brother was Emperor Kogen.

sen.j: 『古事記』では夜麻登登母母曾毘売命。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she was Yamatotomomosobime no Mikoto.
According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she was Yamatotomomosobime no Mikoto.
According to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), she was Yamatotomomosobime no Mikoto.

sen.j: 同母兄弟に日子刺肩別命、比古佐勢理毘古命、倭飛羽矢若屋比売がいる。
sen.e: Her maternal half-brothers were Hikosashi Katawake no mikoto, Hikosaseribiko no mikoto, and Yamatotobihayawakayahime
Her maternal half-brothers were Hikosashi Katawake no mikoto, Hikosaseribiko no mikoto, and Yamatotobihayawakayahime.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを挿入しました。
sen.e: Her maternal half-brothers were Hikosashi Katawake no mikoto, Hikosaseribiko no mikoto, and Yamatotobihayawakayahime.

tit.e: Mythology as a miko (a shrine maiden)
Mythology as a miko (a shrine maiden)
Mythology as a miko (a shrine maiden)

sen.e: She had miko-like character.
She had miko-like character.
She had miko-like character.

sen.j: 紀元前92年に崇神天皇に頼まれて、災害がつづく理由を占うと、三輪山の大物主神が神懸かりして、我を祀れば国は治まるといった。
sen.e: In 92 B.C., when she was asked by Emperor Sujin to read why disasters continued, Omononushi no kami of Mt. Miwa possessed her and spoken that if he were worshipped, the country would be at peace.
In 92 B.C., when she was asked by Emperor Sujin to read why disasters continued, Omononushi no kami of Mt. Miwa possessed her and spoken that if he were worshipped, the country would be at peace.
In 92 B.C., when she was asked by Emperor Sujin to read why disasters continued, Omononushi no kami of Mt. Miwa possessed her and spoken that if he were worshipped, the country would be at peace.

sen.j: そこで崇神は、神の娘大田田根子を大神神社の神主にすると、平和になったという。
sen.e: Therefore, Sujin made Omononushi no kami's daughter, Taneko OTA, to be a shinto priest, and the country became peaceful.
Therefore, Sujin made Omononushi no kami's daughter, Taneko OTA, to be a shinto priest, and the country became peaceful.
Therefore, Sujin made Omononushi no kami's daughter, Taneko OTA, to be a shinto priest, and the country became peaceful.

sen.j: 紀元前88年には、四道将軍の一人、大彦命がきいた童歌から武埴安彦命の反乱を予言したうえ、彼の妻吾田媛と二手に分かれて攻めてくるとも予言し、的中させている。
sen.e: In 88 B.C., she predicted the revolt of Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto from an old children's song that Obiko no Mikoto who was one of the Shido-shogun (Generals Dispatched to Four Circuits) had heard; furthermore, she also made a prediction which came true that divided into two groups with his wife, Ata hime Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto would make an attack.

In 88 B.C., she predicted the revolt of Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto from an old children's song that Obiko no Mikoto who was one of the Shido-shogun (Generals Dispatched to Four Circuits) had heard; furthermore, she also made a prediction which came true that divided into two groups with his wife, Ata hime Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto would make an attack.

In 88 B.C., she predicted the revolt of Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto from an old children's song that Obiko no Mikoto who was one of the Shido-shogun (Generals Dispatched to Four Circuits) had heard; furthermore, she also made a prediction which came true that divided into two groups with his wife, Ata hime Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto would make an attack.

sen.j: 崇神紀十年の条に有名な箸墓伝説が記されている。
sen.e: There is a famous legend of HashihakaIn in an article in the tenth year of Suijin-ki.
There is a famous legend of Hashihaka in an article in the tenth year of Suijin-ki.
There is a famous legend of Hashihaka in an article in the tenth year of Suijin-ki.

sen.j: 倭迹迹日百襲媛命大物主神の妻となるが、大物主の本体が蛇であることを知って驚き、倒れこみ、箸が陰部に刺さって死んだ。
sen.e: Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto became the wife of Omono nushi no kami, but she fell down in surprise when she found out that the true form of Omono nushi to be a snake, and died because a chopstick had stuck into her private parts.

Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto became the wife of Omono nushi no kami, but she fell down in surprise when she found out that the true form of Omono nushi to be a snake, and died because a chopstick had stuck into her private parts.

Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto became the wife of Omono nushi no kami, but she fell down in surprise when she found out that the true form of Omono nushi to be a snake, and died because a chopstick had stuck into her private parts.

sen.j: 箸墓古墳は、彼女の墓と伝わる。
sen.e: Hashihaka tomb was passed down as the tomb of Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto.
Hashihaka tomb was passed down as the tomb of Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto.
Hashihaka tomb was passed down as the tomb of Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto.

tit.e: A legend that identifies her as Himiko (first known ruler of Japan)
A legend that identifies her as Himiko (first known ruler of Japan)
A legend that identifies her as Himiko (first known ruler of Japan)

sen.j: 倭迹迹日百襲媛命を邪馬台国を治めた卑弥呼に比定する説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that identifies Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto as Himiko, who governed Yamatai-Koku kingdom.
There is a theory that identifies Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto as Himiko, who governed Yamatai-Koku kingdom.
There is a theory that identifies Yamatototohimomosohime no mikoto as Himiko, who governed Yamatai-Koku kingdom.
